bugs.title: CVE-2014-7154 kernel: xen: Race condition in HVMOP_track_dirty_vram (XSA-104)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-7154 kernel: xen: Race condition in HVMOP_track_dirty_vram (XSA-104)

long_desc.thetext:
The routine controlling the setup of dirty video RAM tracking latches
the value of a pointer before taking the respective guarding lock, thus
making it possible for a stale pointer to be used by the time the lock
got acquired and the pointer gets dereferenced.

Malicious or buggy stub domain kernels or tool stacks otherwise living
outside of Domain0 can mount a denial of service attack which, if
successful, can affect the whole system.

Only domains controlling HVM guests can exploit this vulnerability.
(This includes domains providing hardware emulation services to HVM
guests.)

Acknowledgements:

Red Hat would like to thank the Xen for reporting this issue.

Statement:

Not vulnerable.

This issue did not affect the versions of the kernel-xen package as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1145736]

bugs.title: CVE-2014-7155 kernel: xen: Missing privilege level checks in x86 HLT, LGDT, LIDT, and LMSW emulation (XSA-105)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-7155 kernel: xen: Missing privilege level checks in x86 HLT, LGDT, LIDT, and LMSW emulation (XSA-105)

long_desc.thetext:
The emulation of the instructions HLT, LGDT, LIDT, and LMSW fails to
perform supervisor mode permission checks.

Malicious HVM guest user mode code may be able to crash the guest or
escalate its own privilege to guest kernel mode.

Acknowledgements:

Red Hat would like to thank the Xen for reporting this issue.

Statement:

Not vulnerable.

This issue did not affect the versions of the kernel-xen package as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1145737]

bugs.title: CVE-2014-7156 kernel: xen: Missing privilege level checks in x86 emulation of software interrupts (XSA-106)

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2014-7156 kernel: xen: Missing privilege level checks in x86 emulation of software interrupts (XSA-106)

long_desc.thetext:
The emulation of instructions which generate software interrupts fails
to perform supervisor mode permission checks.

Malicious HVM guest user mode code may be able to crash the guest.

Acknowledgements:

Red Hat would like to thank the Xen for reporting this issue.

Statement:

Not vulnerable.

This issue did not affect the versions of the kernel-xen package as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.

Created xen tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1145738]
